The idea of the site is for it to be a resource for business owners who need practical advice for marketing their websites. the URL is http://www.webmarketingnz.com Have a look and let me know what you think, but please, be gentle, as it has been a massive undertaking writing all of that content (and yes, it is all original)! Michelle

Tuesday June 22 2004 was the day I finally stopped procrastinating and put urlLink Web Marketing NZ live. Work on the site started over a year earlier after I quit my job. I started writing a website planning guide, something that I thought was going to be an e-book. A few weeks later I left for my trip around Europe. When I came back 3 months later I had no job, no car, and very little money. Got a job and settled back into the 9 to 5 routine. But I continued to write and eventually decided the writing would become a website. And so, the site was live. A scary moment as I was not sure it was really ready for viewing, but I knew that if I kept putting it off it would never get online!

This blog is about the development and marketing of a website I have created. I thought it would be an interesting way of recording the site's history and what works and doesn't work with the web marketing.
Submitted the site to the open directory at www.dmoz.org under this category Computers: Internet: Web Design and Development: Promotion: Guides
Submitted the site to the following search engines... Yahoo WotBox Scrub the Web MSN Gigablast ExactSeek EntireWeb
Checking my stats I see that Googlebot paid the site a visit last night. Alexa's bot paid a visit about 20 minutes later.
Have added the Google AdSense adverts to the web design section of the site. Google has not fully spidered the site yet so the adverts being displayed are for good causes.
Recieved an email from Google saying the site has been accepted into the Google AdSense programme. Keen to get started with it.
Last night I applied to join the Google AdSense program. Had read a lot about people's experiences on the program over at www.webmasterworld.com . Maybe it's too soon to try it out?
Added a news section to the homepage which focuses on web news.
I start with the New Zealand search sites and get the site on SearchNZ, NZSearch and NZPages. Find I am on on NZS.com but can't remember requesting it!
Find in my logs that Google can back on 12 July 2004. Still only have the homepage included in the index.
Yes, that's it, a whole 4 pages have been indexed by Yahoo. Oh dear, things are moving very slowly.
Got my first search engine referral today - it was from a New Zealand search website, someone using the phrase urlLink 'search engine marketing & promotion' very exciting.

BODY { BACKGROUND-POSITION: left top; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND-REPEAT: no-repeat; FONT-FAMILY: Georgia } Realised I am being a bit of a baby about the site and have decided to spent a bit of this weekend looking for links. I know the power of building up links, and may also have to consider paying for a few of them such as on the website directories. Though I am not too keen on doing this. I spend all day marketing other people's websites so it is a good experience for me to go through wondering when I am going to see a return on investment on mine.
Submitted to www.gonzoz.com which is an Australian and New Zealand Web Site Directory Received an email from them a few days ago suggesting I add my site to their directory.

Getting more visitors from NZSearch - with someone searching for http://www.searchnz.co.nz/cgi-bin/search?q=online+website+advertising and Web Marketing NZ ranked at number 6. Also can see that I am getting some hits on 'budget website" terms after having moved the budget website address over to Web Marketing NZ. Ranking well in NZSearch for these terms too.
Submitted the site to the Web World Index at urlLink http://www.webworldindex.com

Well, having checked my stats it seems that visitors are landing on some particular pages within the site, but it is not showing any search engine referrals. Might have to invest in some better stats.

After writing so much information and re-writing and thinking I had a great concept I now realise how clients feel! Google is not taking much notice of me. It keeps coming back, but does it index any more pages. NO! I am feeling as impatient as the next website owner. I know about the Google sandbox, I know the site is only just a month old, but I want traffic! Have done very little to the site due to time being taken up with many other things. I know I need to be spending this time writing more content, but I don't know if I have the heart to do it. Keen to start on a new idea I have had but know I need to keep on concentrating on the Web Marketing site before diving on into to something else.

Go confirmation that GONZOZ have added a link to the category I requested. Refreshing to get a link back so quickly. Still don't have PR, and Google is not showing any backlinks.
